{"step_by_step_thinking": "Hemoglobin (Hb) is a protein in red blood cells that carries oxygen throughout the body. In humans, the most common type of hemoglobin is HbA, which is composed of two alpha globins and two beta globins. This is stated in Document [2], Document [3], and Document [21]. The other options, HbH, HbM, and HbS, are variants of hemoglobin, but they are not the predominant type in humans.", "answer_choice": "B"}
